text: Gevotroline (WY-47,384) is an atypical antipsychotic with a tricyclic structure which was under development for the treatment of schizophrenia by Wyeth-Ayerst. It acts as a balanced, modest affinity D2 and 5-HT2 receptor antagonist and also possesses high affinity for the sigma receptor. It was well tolerated and showed efficacy in phase II clinical trials but was never marketed. == See also == * Atypical antipsychotic * Atiprosin * Azepindole == References == Category:Abandoned drugs Category:Atypical antipsychotics Category:Fluoroarenes Category:Pyridines Category:Pyridoindoles Category:Gamma-Carbolines
title: Gevotroline
